definition: to extinguish/to put out (fire)/to quench/to stop burning/to go out (of fire, lamp etc)/to come to an end/to wither away/to die out/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: After taps was blown the young campers had to turn out their lights and go to bed.
sentences.chinese: 吹过熄灯号后，那些青年露营者就得熄灯睡觉。

sentences.english: After taps was blown the young campers had to turn out their lights and go to bed.
sentences.chinese: 吹过熄灯号后，那些青年露营者就得熄灯睡觉。

sentences.english: Get up with adjustments bell, lights-out bell time function.
sentences.chinese: 具有调整起床铃，熄灯铃时间的功能。

sentences.english: We see classroom light-off all the time in the evening, the aunt drives a talent to go.
sentences.chinese: 晚上我们一直看到教室熄灯，阿姨赶人才走。

sentences.english: Night getting deeper, bugles of some far-away barracks streaked across the sky.
sentences.chinese: 夜渐渐深了，天空划过远处军营传来的熄灯号声。

sentences.english: Organizers estimate over 1 billion people take part in the global blackout.
sentences.chinese: 组织者估计有10亿人参与全球熄灯。

sentences.english: Thelightlights will stayupoff for one hour foran event called Earth Hour.
sentences.chinese: 熄灯一小时是为了响应地球一小时的活动。

sentences.english: Students should abide by the rules for study and rest in the dormitory and should respect the regulated dormitory sleeping hours.
sentences.chinese: 学生应严格遵守作息制度，自觉按时熄灯就寝。

definition: to go to sleep/to go to bed (literary)
to study outside of class time (reviewing one's lessons)/to study in one's free time/individual study
to go to bed/(coll.) to have sex
midnight/in the middle of the night
